title: Electricity prices slated to rise as Govt. under duress from IMF
byline: The government is under compulsion to increase electricity prices since the International Monetary Fund (IMF) will unlock the next tranche of US$ $ 344 million, contingent on the restoration of cost recovery pricing, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Suryavanshi, 14, makes history with stunning IPL century
byline: Rajasthan Royals’ 14-year-old batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi made history as the youngest player to hit a century in men’s T20s.

title: CSE establishes Central Counterparty to enhance market stability
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has unveiled an initiative to bolster market efficiency and reduce systemic risk with the establishment of a Central Counterparty (CCP) through its newly formed entity, CSE Clear (Private) Limited.

title: Illegal confectionery floods SL market: Leading confectioner warns
byline: A rise in illegal confectionery products entering Sri Lanka’s local market is posing significant challenges for the legitimate businesses and creating health risks for the consumers, a top industry representative warns.

title: How does AKD know my correspondence with Bribery Commission? asks Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe asked yesterday how President Anura Kumara Dissanayake was aware of his correspondence with the Bribery Commission on negotiating a date for him to testify before it.

title: Shooting in Panadura: One dead, one injured
byline: One person was killed and another injured following a shooting incident reported in Panadura this morning by two unidentified men who arrived on a motorbike, police said.

title: Spain and Portugal declare states of emergency after massive power outage
byline: Spain and Portugal are reeling from a massive, unexplained power outage that knocked out traffic lights, caused chaos on roads and in airports, and prompted both countries to declare a state of emergency.

title: Canada’s Liberals projected to win election overshadowed by Trump’s threats
byline: Canada’s Liberal Party, led by Prime Minister Mark Carney, is on course to win the country’s federal election, Canadian media projects, following a campaign overshadowed by provocations and tariffs from US President Donald Trump.

title: AKD only quoted social media post: Nalinda responds to Ranil
byline: Claiming that summoning former President Ranil Wickremesinghe before the Bribery Commission was not a secret, Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said today that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake only quoted Ranil’s social media post on his correspondence with the Bribery Commission.

title: President to visit Vietnam in May
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will undertake an official visit to Vietnam from May 3 to 6, Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: SJB looking toward forming joint administrations in local bodies
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is looking toward forming joint administrations in local bodies with the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) and other parties, the party’s National Organiser Tissa Attanayake said today.

title: Lightning kills female LG candidate at Neluwatta Estate
byline: A 47-year-old woman, a candidate for the Hali-Ela Pradeshiya Sabha under the Ceylon Workers’ Congress, was killed after being struck by lightning while taking shelter during heavy rain at Neluwatta Estate.

title: US Navy loses $100 million jet at sea after it fell overboard from aircraft carrier
byline: A US Navy F/A-18 Super Hornet fighter jet has been ’’lost’’ at sea after it fell overboard from the USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier while it was being towed on board, the Navy said in a statement.

title: 30 injured in Beliatta–Dikwella bus collision
byline: Thirty passengers were injured this morning when two buses collided near the Hettiarachchi Junction on the Beliatta–Dikwella Road.

title: Teachers in the election fray flout law by drawing salaries: Trade Union
byline: Ceylon Teacher Union said several employees of the Education Department contesting the Local Government election have obtained their April salary, which is a violation of the election law and the Establishment Code.

title: Man dies after being hit by car on Southern Expressway
byline: A 41-year-old man died after being struck by a car while inspecting his broken-down vehicle on the Southern Expressway near Kahathuduwa last evening.

title: Colombo Strikers, Jaffna Kings franchise agreements terminated
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) in collaboration with the event rights holder of the Lanka Premier League (LPL), the IPG Group, has officially announced the termination of the franchise partnerships of the Colombo Strikers and Jaffna Kings.

title: CCD hunts suspect in multi-million fraud
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today released a photograph of a suspect wanted in connection with a financial fraud totalling Rs. 28.5 million.

title: Government to conduct economic census
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal by the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to conduct an economic census in 2025 and 2026, with agricultural activities being covered in 2025 and non-agricultural activities in 2026.

title: Murderers, gangs now control society: Sajith
byline: The law in the country has gone wild, and lawlessness has taken effect. Everything in our society is controlled by murderers, extortionists and drug dealers.

title: Chinese authorities say 22 people killed, 3 injured in restaurant fire in northern city of Liaoning
byline: Chinese authorities say 22 people have been killed and 3 injured in a fire at restaurant in the northern city of Liaoning,according to the foreign media reports .

title: Kottahachchi does it again!!
byline: Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa admitted that there seems to be a mistake in the figures presented by National People’s Power (NPP) MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi about the cost of text messages sent by the President for the New Year during the previous government.

title: President appoints Solicitor General Viraj Dayaratne as acting AG
byline: Solicitor General Viraj Dayaratne has been appointed acting Attorney General by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Public urged not to panic over fake heat alert
byline: The Meteorological Department denied the high alert warning currently circulating on social media about temperatures rising to 45 degrees Celsius and urged the public not to panic.

title: Market holds firm amid strengthening macroeconomic conditions
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its positive trajectory for the fourth consecutive trading session, supported by a strong rebound in investor sentiment driven by a positive economic outlook.

title: Health Ministry launches 2025 NCD status survey
byline: The latest survey on the status of non-communicable diseases (NCD), including diabetes, hypertension and related trends in Sri Lanka, will be conducted this year, the Health Ministry announced.

title: Largest container ship arrives at the Colombo Port
byline: The MSC Mariella, known as the world’s largest container ship, arrived at the Eastern Container Terminal (ECT) of the Colombo Port yesterday (28).

title: Batalanda Commission report referred to Attorney General after 25 years
byline: The long-awaited Batalanda Commission report, which investigates into the alleged establishment of illegal detention centres and torture chambers at the Batalanda housing complex, has been referred to the Attorney General by the Presidential Secretariat following a directive from President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.
